chapter.title: Logging
chapter.para: JBM leverages the Java Logging framework, JUL, for all its logging meaning we have no dependencies on any logging framework. Users can provide their own logging handler to use or alternatively use one of the handlers provided by JBM. There are 2 of these a Log4j handler and a JBoss logging handler.

The handlers are configured via the JUL logging.properties file. This default location for this file is under the lib directory found in the Java home directory however can be overriden. The standalone JBM server does this and the logging.properties file can be found under the config directory of the JBM installation.

If using the JBoss handler the property org.jboss.logging.Logger.pluginClass must be set. By default this is set to org.jboss.messaging.integration.logging.JBMLoggerPlugin in the standalone server. Only change this property if you want to use your own plugin class.

note.para: If running JBM within the JBoss Application Server logging will default to what ever the AS is using. Refer to the AS docs for more info on how to configure logging.
